article.title: Dr._Dre
article.paragraph: Aboutthe rapperthe New York State radio and television presenterDoctor DréDistinguishDr. DrewRedirectAndre Youngpp-semi-blpyesUse mdy datesJune 2011Infobox musical artistDr. Dre Dr. Dre in 2011.jpg Dr. Dre in 2011 solo_singer Andre Romelle Young<ref name{{Birth date and age|mf[[Compton, California]], United States Nicole Young (m. 1996) [[Los Angeles]], [[California]], United States {{flatlist| * Record producer * rapper * entrepreneur }} 1984–present {{flatlist| * Vocals * synthesizer * keyboards * turntables * drum machine * sampler }} {{flatlist| * [[Hip hop music|Hip hop]] * [[gangsta rap]] * [[g-funk]] }} {{flatlist| * [[Kru-Cut Records]] {{small|(1984–1986)}} * [[Ruthless Records]] {{small|(1986–1991)}} * [[Priority Records]] {{small|(1988–1991)}} * [[Death Row Records]] {{small|(1991–1996)}} * [[Interscope Records]] {{small|(1992–present)}} * [[Aftermath Entertainment]] {{small|(1996–present)}} }} {{flatlist| * [[World Class Wreckin' Cru]] * [[N.W.A]] * [[Cold 187um]] * [[Michel'le]] * [[The D.O.C.]] * [[Warren G]] * [[Snoop Dogg]] * [[Nate Dogg]] * [[Tha Dogg Pound]] * [[Tupac Shakur|2Pac]] * [[Xzibit]] * [[Eminem]] * [[50 Cent]] *[[Obie Trice]] * [[The Game (rapper)|The Game]] * [[Kendrick Lamar]] *[[D12]] |websiteAndre Romelle Young(born February 18, 1965), known by hisstage nameDr. Dre, is an American record producer, rapper and entrepreneur. He is the founder and current CEO ofAftermath EntertainmentandBeats Electronics. Dre was previously the co-owner of, and an artist on,Death Row Records. He has produced albums for and overseen the careers of many rappers, includingThe D.O.C.,Snoop Dogg,Eminem,Xzibit,Knoc-turn'al,50 Cent,Game (rapper)The GameandKendrick Lamar. He is credited as a key figure in the popularization ofWest Coast hip hopWest CoastG-funk, a style ofrapmusiccharacterized as synthesizer-based with slow, heavy beats. In 2014, Dr. Dre was ranked as the second richest figure in the American hip hop scene byForbes magazineForbeswith a net worth of $550 million;cite webThe Forbes Five: Hip-Hop's Wealthiest Artists 2014http://www.forbes.com/sites/zackomalleygreenburg/2014/04/16/the-forbes-five-hip-hops-wealthiest-artists-2014/Forbes MagazineMay 5, 2014November 11, 2014he is at the top of the 2015Forbeslist, with an estimated pre-tax take of $620 million in 2014.cite journalhttp://www3.forbes.com/forbes/the-worlds-30-highest-paid-musicians-2/32/World’s 30 Highest Paid Musicians: 1. Dr. Dre: $620 millionGreenburgZack O'MalleyZack O'Malley GreenburgMarch 26, 2015Forbes MagazineMarch 26, 2015

Dre began his career as a member of theWorld Class Wreckin' Cruand later found fame with the influentialgangsta rapgroupN.W.AwithEazy-E,Ice Cube,MC Ren, andDJ Yella, which popularized the use of explicit lyrics in rap to detail the violence of street life. His 1992 solo debutThe Chronic, released under Death Row Records, led him to become one of the best-selling American performing artists of 1993 and to win aGrammy Awardfor the single "Let Me Ride". That same year he produced Death Row labelmate Snoop Dogg's quadruple platinum debutDoggystyle, and even molded artists into top-notch producers such as his step-brotherWarren G, which led to his multi-platinum debutRegulate...G Funk Erain 1994, and Snoop Dogg's cousinDaz Dillingerwhich led to the double platinum debut albumDogg FoodbyTha Dogg Poundin 1995.

In 1996, he left Death Row Records to establish his own label, Aftermath Entertainment. He produced a compilation album titledDr. Dre Presents the Aftermathin 1996, and released a solo album titled2001 (Dr. Dre album)2001in 1999. During the 2000s, he focused on production for other artists, while occasionally contributing vocals to songs. Dr. Dre signed Eminem and 50 Cent to his record label in 1998 and 2002 respectively, while contributing production on their albums. He has won sixGrammy Awards, includingGrammy Award for Producer of the Year, Non-ClassicalProducer of the Year. Dr. Dre has also had acting roles in movies such asSet It Off (film)Set It Off,The Wash (2001 film)The WashandTraining Day.Rolling Stoneranked Dre at 56 on their list of "100 Greatest Artists of All-Time".
article.heading: Early life
article.paragraph: Andre Romelle Young was born inCompton, Californiaon February 18, 1965. He was the first child of Theodore and Verna Young. Young's middle name, Romelle, is derived from his father's amateurRhythm and bluesR&Bsinging group, The Romells. Married in 1964, Young's parents separated in 1968 and divorced in 1972.rp7–8Verna later married Curtis Crayon. They had three children together, two sons named Jerome and Tyree (both deceased)rp7,25and daughter Shameka.rp6–8

In 1976, Young began attending Vanguard Junior High School in Compton, but due togangviolence, he transferred to the safer suburban Roosevelt Junior High School.rp9Verna later married Warren Griffin, whom she met at her new job in Long Beach,rp10which added three stepsisters and one stepbrother to the family. His stepbrother Warren Griffin III would eventually become rapperWarren G.cite bookKenyattaKellyhttp://books.google.com/?idYou Forgot About Dre!: The Unauthorized Biography of Dr. Dre and Eminem: from NWA to Slim Shady: a Tale of Gangsta Rap, Violence, and Hit RecordsLos AngelesBusta Books2001978-0-970-22249-745162196rp14Young attendedCentennial High School (Compton, California)Centennial High Schoolin Compton during his freshman year in 1979, but transferred toJohn C. Fremont High SchoolFremont High Schoolin South Central Los Angeles due to poor grades. Young attempted to enroll in an apprenticeship program atNorthrop CorporationNorthrop Aviation Company, but poor grades at school made him ineligible. Thereafter, he focused on his social life and entertainment for the remainder of his high school years.rp2Young fathered a son, Curtis, born December 15, 1981, with Lisa Johnson. Curtis Young was brought up by his mother and first met his father 20 years later, when Curtis became rapper Hood Surgeon.rp11
article.heading: Music career
198485: World Class Wreckin' Cru
article.paragraph: Inspired by theGrandmaster Flashsong "The Adventures of Grandmaster Flash on the Wheels of Steel", he often attended a club called Eve After Dark to watch many DJs and rappers performing live. He subsequently became a DJ in the club, initially under the name "Dr. J", based on the nickname ofJulius Erving, his favorite basketball player. At the club, he met aspiring rapper Antoine Carraby, later to become memberDJ YellaofN.W.A.Rp15Soon afterwards he adopted the moniker Dr. Dre, a mix of previous alias Dr. J and his first name, referring to himself as the "Master of Mixology".rp14Eve After Dark had a back room with a small four-track studio. In this studio, Dre and Yella recorded several demos. In their first recording session, they recorded a song entitled "Surgery", with the lyrics "calling Dr. Dre to surgery" serving as the chorus to the song.cite webhttp://www.oxfordmusiconline.com.ezproxy2.library.arizona.edu/subscriber/article/epm/53888Dr. Dre - Encyclopedia of Popular Music, 4th ed.20 Jul 2015Oxford Music OnlineOxford University PressLarkinColinHe later joined the musical groupWorld Class Wreckin' Cruunder the independentKru-Cut Recordsin 1984. The group would become stars of the electro-hop scene that dominated early 1980sWest Coast hip hop. "Surgery", which was officially released after being recorded prior to the group's official formation, would prominently feature Dr. Dre on the turntable. The record would become the group's first hit, selling 50,000 copies within the Compton area.rp14–15

Dr. Dre and DJ Yella also performed mixes for local radio stationKDAY, boosting ratings for its afternoon rush-hour showThe Traffic Jam.rp17Dr. Dre's earliest recordings were released in 1994 on a compilation titledConcrete Roots. Stephen Thomas Erlewine of the websiteAllmusicdescribed the compiled music, released "several years before Dre developed a distinctive style", as "surprisingly generic and unengaging" and "for dedicated fans only".cite webErlewineStephen Thomas"Concrete Roots" >Overview{{Allmusic|classAllmusicJune 26, 2008

His frequent absences from school jeopardized his position as a diver on his school's swim team. After high school, he attended Chester Adult School in Compton following his mother's demands for him to get a job or continue his education. After brief attendance at a radio broadcasting school, he relocated to the residence of his father and residence of his grandparents before returning to his mother's house.rp18–19He later dropped out of Chester to focus on performing at the Eve's After Dark nightclub.
article.heading: 198691: N.W.A and Ruthless Records
article.paragraph: listenleftN.W.A - Fuck Tha Police.ogg"Fuck Tha Police"from ''[[Straight Outta Compton]]''[[Ogg]]In 1986, Dr. Dre met rapperIce CubeO'Shea Jacksonnicknamed Ice Cubewho collaborated with Dr. Dre to record songs forRuthless Records, a rap record label run by local rapperEazy-E.N.W.Aand fellow West Coast rapperIce-Tare widely credited as seminal artists of the gangsta rap genre, a profanity-heavy subgenre of hip hop, replete with gritty depictions of urban crime and gang lifestyle. Not feeling constricted to racially charged political issues pioneered by rap artists such asPublic Enemy (band)Public EnemyorBoogie Down Productions, N.W.A favored themes and uncompromising lyrics, offering stark descriptions of violent, inner-city streets. Propelled by the hit "Fuck tha Police", the group's first full albumStraight Outta Comptonbecame a major success, despite an almost complete absence of radio airplay or major concert tours. TheFederal Bureau of Investigationsent Ruthless Records a warning letter in response to the song's content.cite webErlewineStephen ThomasStephen Thomas ErlewineDr. Dre – Biographyhttp://www.allmusic.com/artist/dr-dre-mn0000805274/biographyAllmusic2000September 22, 2007

After Ice Cube left N.W.A in 1989 over financial disputes, Dr. Dre produced and performed for much of the group's second albumEfil4zaggin. He also produced tracks for a number of other acts on Ruthless Records, including Eazy-E's 1988 solo debutEazy-Duz-It,Above the Law (group)Above the Law's 1990 debutLivin' Like Hustlers,Michel'le's 1989Michel'le (album)self title'd debut,The D.O.C.'s 1989 debutNo One Can Do It Better,J.J. Fad's 1988 debutSupersonic (J. J. Fad album)Supersonicand funk rock musicianJimmy Z's 1991 albumMuzical Madnesscite webQ&A w/The D.O.C.: From Ruthless to Death Rowhttp://www.thaformula.com/doc_ruthless_to_death_row_thaformula_music.htmlThaFormula.com2004http://web.archive.org/web/20100409061930/http://www.thaformula.com/doc_ruthless_to_death_row_thaformula_music.htmlApril 9, 2010
article.heading: 199296:The Chronicand Death Row Records

template.arg: Dr. Dre - Nuthin' But a "G" Thang.ogg

article.paragraph: After a dispute with Eazy-E, Dre left the group at the peak of its popularity in 1991 under the advice of friend, and N.W.A lyricist, The D.O.C. and his bodyguard at the time,Suge Knight. Knight, a notorious strongman and intimidator, was able to have Eazy-E release Young from his contract and, using Dr. Dre as his flagship artist, foundedDeath Row Records. In 1992 Young released his first single, theDeep Cover (song)title trackto the filmDeep Cover, a collaboration with rapperSnoop Dogg, whom he met through Warren G.Dr. Dre's debut solo album wasThe Chronic, released under Death Row Records with Suge Knight as executive producer. Young ushered in a new style of rap, both in terms of musical style and lyrical content, including introducing a number of artists to the industry including Snoop Dogg,Kurupt,Daz Dillinger,RBX,The Lady of Rage,Nate DoggandJewell (singer)Jewell.cite webHueySteve"The Chronic" – Overview{{Allmusic|classAllmusicSeptember 22, 2007

On the strength of singles such as "Nuthin' but a "G" ThangNuthin' but a 'G' Thang", "Let Me Ride", and "Fuck wit Dre Day (and Everybody's Celebratin')" (known as "Dre Day" for radio and television play), all of which featured Snoop Dogg as guest vocalist,The Chronicbecame a cultural phenomenon, itsG-funksound dominating much of hip hop music for the early 1990s.In 1993 theRecording Industry Association of America(RIAA) certified the album triple platinum,cite webhttp://riaa.com/goldandplatinumdata.php?artistGold & Platinum Dr. Dre[[Recording Industry Association of America]]April 4, 2013and Dr. Dre also won theGrammy Award for Best Rap Solo Performancefor his performance on "Let Me Ride".cite webDr. Dre – Grammy Awards{{Allmusic|classAllmusicFebruary 17, 2008For that year,Billboardmagazine also ranked Dr. Dre as the eighth best-selling musical artist,The Chronicas the sixth best-selling album, and "Nuthin' but a 'G' Thang" as the 11th best-selling single.cite newsHoldenStephenThe Pop Lifehttp://www.nytimes.com/1994/01/12/movies/the-pop-life-849405.html?pagewantedThe New York TimesJanuary 14, 1994March 3, 2008

Besides working on his own material, Dr. Dre produced Snoop Dogg's debut albumDoggystyle, which became the first debut album for an artist to enter theBillboard 200''Billboard'' 200album charts at number one.cite webErlewineStephen ThomasStephen Thomas Erlewine"Doggystyle" – Overview{{Allmusic|classAllmusicFebruary 15, 2008In 1994 Dr. Dre produced some songs on the soundtracks to the filmsAbove the RimandMurder Was the Case. He collaborated with fellow N.W.A member Ice Cube for the song "Natural Born Killaz" in 1995.For the filmFriday (1995 film)Friday, Dre recorded "Keep Their Heads Ringin'", which reached number ten on theBillboardHot 100 and number 1 on the Hot Rap Singles (now Hot Rap Tracks) charts.cite web{{Allmusic|classDr. Dre – AwardsAllmusicJanuary 1, 2009

In 1995, Death Row Records signed rapperTupac Shakur2Pac, and began to position him as their major star: he collaborated with Dr. Dre on the commercially successful single "California Love", which became both artists' first song to top theBillboardHot 100.cite journalhttp://books.google.co.uk/books?idBone Broken: 2Pac Takes Over At No. 1[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]][[Prometheus Global Media]]July 1996108281180006-2510April 11, 2013However, in March 1996 Young left the label amidst a contract dispute and growing concerns that label boss Suge Knight was corrupt, financially dishonest and out of control. Later that year, he formed his own label, Aftermath Entertainment, under the distribution label for Death Row Records,Interscope Records.Subsequently, Death Row Records suffered poor sales by 1997, especially following the death of 2Pac and theRacket (crime)racketeeringcharges brought against Knight.cite webHueySteveSuge Knight – Biography{{Allmusic|classAllmusic2003February 17, 2008

Dr. Dre also appeared on the single "No Diggity" byContemporary R&BR&BgroupBlackstreetin 1996: it too was a sales success, topping the Hot 100 for four consecutive weeks, and later won the award for Best R&B Vocal by a Duo or Group at the1997 Grammy Awards.cite webhttp://www.allmusic.com/artist/blackstreet-mn0000049774Blackstreet - BiographyAllmusicApril 11, 2013Huey, SteveAfter hearing it for the first time, several of Dr. Dre's former Death Row colleagues, including 2Pac, recorded and attempted to release a song titled "Toss It Up", containing numerous insults aimed at Dr. Dre and using a deliberately similar instrumental to "No Diggity", but were forced to replace the production after Blackstreet issued the label with acease and desistorder stopping them from distributing the song.cite webhttp://www.hiphopdx.com/index/news/id.11343/title.danny-boy-tells-all-about-death-row-years-part-twoDanny Boy Tells All About Death Row Years, Part TwoCheri Media GroupHipHopDXMay 27, 2010April 11, 2013Arnold, Paul W.
article.heading: 199698: Move to Aftermath Entertainment
article.paragraph: TheDr. Dre Presents the Aftermathalbum, released on November 26, 1996, featured songs by Dr. Dre himself, as well as by newly signedAftermath Entertainmentartists, and a solo track "Been There, Done That", intended as a symbolic farewell togangsta rap.cite webErlewineStephen ThomasStephen Thomas Erlewine"Dr. Dre Presents...The Aftermath" – Overview{{Allmusic|classAllmusicFebruary 17, 2008Despite being classified platinum by the RIAA,the album was not very popular among music fans.In October 1996, Dre performed "Been There, Done That" onSaturday Night Live.cite episodeDana Carvey/Dr. Drehttp://www.nbc.com/Saturday_Night_Live/episodes/Show_963.shtml[[Saturday Night Live]]22-41996-10-26[[NBC]]In 1997, Dr. Dre produced several tracks onThe Firm (hip hop group)The Firm'sThe Album (The Firm album)The Album; it was met with largely negative reviews from critics. Rumors began to abound that Aftermath was facing financial difficulties.cite webBirchmeierJasonThe Firm – Biography{{Allmusic|classAllmusicSeptember 22, 2007Aftermath Entertainment also faced atrademark infringementlawsuit by the underground thrash metal band Aftermath.Tsiolis v. Interscope. Records. Inc., 946 F.Supp. 1344, 1349 (N.D.III. 1996).First Round Knock Out, a compilation of various tracks produced and performed by Dr. Dre was also released in 1996, with material ranging from World Class Wreckin' Cru to N.W.A to Death Row recordings.cite webHendersonAlexFirst Round Knock Out >Overview{{Allmusic|classAllmusicJune 26, 2008Dr. Dre chose to take no part in the ongoingEast CoastWest Coast hip hop rivalryof the time, instead producing for, and appearing on, several New York artists' releases, such asNas' "Nas Is Coming",LL Cool J's "Zoom (Dr. Dre song)Zoom" andJay-Z's "Watch Me".

The turning point for Aftermath came in 1998, when Jimmy Iovine, the head of Aftermath's parent label Interscope, suggested that Dr. Dre signEminem, a white rapper fromDetroit. Dre produced three songs and provided vocals for two on Eminem's successful and controversial debut albumThe Slim Shady LP, released in 1999.cite webAnkenyJasonTorreano, BradleyEminem – Biography{{Allmusic|classAllmusic2006September 22, 2007The Dr. Dre-produced lead single from that album, "My Name Is", brought Eminem to public attention for the first time, and the success ofThe Slim Shady LPit reached number two on theBillboard200 and received general acclaim from critics revived the label's commercial ambitions and viability.cite webhttp://www.allmusic.com/album/the-slim-shady-lp-mw0000601851/awardsThe Slim Shady LP – Eminem – AwardsAllmusicApril 11, 2013cite webhttp://rap.about.com/od/artists/p/DrDreBio.htmDr. Dre Bio - A Brief Biography of Andre Dr. Dre Young[[About.com]]. [[The New York Times Company]]April 11, 2013Adaso, Henry

Dr. Dre's second solo album,2001 (Dr. Dre album)2001, released on November 16, 1999, was considered an ostentatious return to his gangsta rap roots.cite webErlewineStephen ThomasStephen Thomas Erlewine"2001" – Overview{{Allmusic|classAllmusic1999February 17, 2008It was initially titledThe Chronic 2000to imply being a sequel to his debut solo effortThe Chronicbut was re-titled2001after Death Row Records released an unrelated compilation album with the titleChronic 2000: Still Smokinin May 1999. Other tentative titles includedThe Chronic 2001andDr. Dre.The album featured numerous collaborators, includingDevin the Dude, Snoop Dogg, Kurupt,Xzibit, Nate Dogg, Eminem,Knoc-turn'al,King T,Defari,Kokane,Mary J. Bligeand new protgHittman (rapper)Hittman, as well as co-production between Dre and new Aftermath producerMel-Man.Stephen Thomas Erlewineof the websiteAllMusicdescribed the sound of the album as "adding ominousstrings (music)strings, soulful vocals, andreggae" to Dr. Dre's style.The album was highly successful, charting at number two on theBillboard 200''Billboard'' 200chartscite webDr. Dre – ''Billboard'' Albums{{Allmusic|classAllmusicSeptember 22, 2007and has since been certified six times platinum,validating a recurring theme on the album: Dr. Dre was still a force to be reckoned with, despite the lack of major releases in the previous few years. The album included popular hit singles "Still D.R.E." and "Forgot About Dre", both of which Dr. Dre performed on NBC'sSaturday Night Liveon October 23, 1999.cite episodeNorm Macdonald/Dr. Drehttp://www.nbc.com/Saturday_Night_Live/episodes/Show_1119.shtml[[Saturday Night Live]]1999-10-23[[NBC]]24-3Dr. Dre won theGrammy AwardforProducer of the Year, Non-Classicalin 2000,and joined the Up in Smoke Tour with fellow rappers Eminem, Snoop Dogg, and Ice Cube that year as well.cite newsParelesJonFour Hours Of Swagger From Dr. Dre And Friendshttp://www.slate.com/id/2114375/The New York TimesJuly 17, 2000May 24, 2008

During the course of2001's popularity, Dr. Dre was involved in several lawsuits.Lucasfilm Ltd., the film company behind theStar WarsStar Wars film franchise, sued him over the use of theTHX-trademarked "Deep Note".cite newsJohnsonTinaDr. Dre Sued By Lucasfilmhttp://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1428253/20000419/dr_dre.jhtmlMTV NewsApril 19, 2000May 10, 2008The Fatback Band also sued Dr. Dre over alleged infringement regarding its song "Backstrokin'" in his song "Let's Get High" from the2001album; Dr. Dre was ordered to pay $1.5 million to the band in 2003.cite webhttp://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1471763/20030507/dr_dre.jhtmlDre must pay 1.5 millionMay 21, 2008MossCoreyMay 7, 2003MTVThe online music file-sharing companyNapsteralso settled a lawsuit with him and heavy metal rock bandMetallicain the summer of 2001, agreeing to block access to certain files that artists do not want to have shared on the network.cite newsNapster settles suitshttp://money.cnn.com/2001/07/12/news/napster/MoneyCNNJuly 12, 2001April 28, 2008
article.heading: anchor2000–present: Detox2000–2007: Third studio album200107: Focus on production andDetox
article.paragraph: Following the success of2001, Dr. Dre focused on producing songs and albums for other artists. He co-produced six tracks on Eminems landmarkMarshall Mathers LP, including the Grammy-winning lead single,The Real Slim Shady. The album itself earned a Grammy and proved to be the fastest-selling rap album of all time, moving 1.76 million units in its first week alone.cite webhttp://www.rollingstone.com/news/story/5923810/eminem_bounces_britney_from_top_spotEminem Bounces Britney From Top SpotRolling StoneMay 31, 2000http://web.archive.org/web/20080503141820/http://www.rollingstone.com/news/story/5923810/eminem_bounces_britney_from_top_spotMay 3, 2008He produced the single "Family Affair (Mary J. Blige song)Family Affair" by R&B singerMary J. Bligefor her albumNo More Dramain 2001.cite webLaFrancoRobertBinelli, MarkGoodman, FredU2, Dre Highest Earning Artistshttp://www.rollingstone.com/news/story/5933378/u2_dre_highest_earning_artistsRolling StoneJune 13, 2002http://web.archive.org/web/20080222024659/http://www.rollingstone.com/news/story/5933378/u2_dre_highest_earning_artistsFebruary 22, 2008He also produced "Let Me Blow Ya Mind", a duet by rapperEve (entertainer)EveandNo Doubtlead singerGwen Stefanicite newsMossCoreyGottliebMeredithEve, Gwen Stefani Bust Loose In Videohttp://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1441675/20010315/eve.jhtmlMTV NewsMarch 15, 2001June 26, 2008and signed R&B singerTruth Hurtsto Aftermath in 2001.cite newsReidShaheemTruth Hurtshttp://www.mtv.com/news/yhif/truth_hurts/You Hear It FirstMTV NewsApril 9, 2002June 26, 2008Dr. Dre was the executive producer of Eminems 2002 release,The Eminem Show. He produced three songs on the album, one of which was released as aBusiness (song)single, and he appeared in the award-winning video forWithout Me (Eminem song)Without Me. He also producedThe D.O.C.'s 2003 albumDeuce (The D.O.C. album)Deuce, where he made a guest appearance on the tracks "Psychic Pymp Hotline", "Gorilla Pympin'" and "Judgment Day".

Another copyright-related lawsuit hit Dr. Dre in the fall of 2002, whenSa Re Ga Ma, a film and music company based inCalcutta, India, sued Aftermath Entertainment over an uncredited sample of theLata Mangeshkarsong "Thoda Resham Lagta Hai" on the Aftermath-produced song "Addictive" by singerTruth Hurts. In February 2003, a judge ruled that Aftermath would have to halt sales of Truth Hurts' albumTruthfully Speakingif the company would not credit Mangeshkar.cite newsKaufmanGilJudge Rules Truth Hurts' Album Must Be Pulled Or Stickeredhttp://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1459838/20030204/truth_hurts.jhtmlMTV NewsFebruary 4, 2003May 24, 2008

Another successful album on the Aftermath label wasGet Rich or Die Tryin' (album)Get Rich or Die Tryin', the 2003 major-label debut album byQueens, New York-based rapper 50 Cent. Dr. Dre produced or co-produced four tracks on the album, including the hit single "In da Club", a joint production between Aftermath, Eminem's boutique labelShady Recordsand Interscope.cite webBirchmeierJason50 Cent – Biography{{Allmusic|classAllmusicSeptember 11, 2007May 24, 2008Eminem's fourth album since joining Aftermath,Encore (Eminem album)Encore, again saw Dre taking on the role of executive producer, and this time he was more actively involved in the music, producing or co-producing a total of eight tracks, including three singles. In November 2004, at theVibemagazine awards show in Los Angeles, Dr. Dre was attacked by a fan named Jimmy James Johnson, who was supposedly asking for an autograph. In the resulting scuffle, then-G-Unit rapperYoung Buckstabbed the man.cite newsMossCoreyWarrant Issued For Young Buck In Vibe Awards Stabbinghttp://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1493786/20041116/young_buck.jhtml?headlinesMTV NewsNovember 16, 2004July 2, 2008Johnson claimed that Suge Knight, president of Death Row Records, paid him $5,000 to assault Dre in order to humiliate him before he received his Lifetime Achievement Award.cite newsSmithPamDr. Dre Puncher Snitches On Suge Knighthttp://www.sohh.com/articles/article.php/6622http://web.archive.org/web/20061127221827/http://www.sohh.com/articles/article.php/6622November 27, 2006SOHHNovember 27, 2006July 2, 2008Knight immediately went onCBS'sThe Late Late Show (CBS TV series)The Late Late Showto deny involvement and insisted that he supported Dr. Dre and wanted Johnson charged.cite webWhy the Lingering Hatehttp://www.thuglifearmy.com/news/?idThugLifeArmy.comJanuary 5, 2005July 2, 2008In September 2005, Johnson was sentenced to a year in prison and ordered to stay away from Dr. Dre until 2008.cite newsKaufmanGilDr. Dre Attacker Sentenced To One Year In Jailhttp://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1509596/20050915/dr_dre.jhtmlMTV NewsSeptember 15, 2005May 25, 2008

Dr. Dre also produced "How We Do (song)How We Do", a 2005 hit single from rapperThe Game (rapper)The Gamefrom his albumThe Documentary,cite webKoernerBrendan I.Dr. Dre, hip-hop's most reliable kingmakerhttp://www.slate.com/id/2114375/SlateMarch 10, 2005May 24, 2008as well as 50 Cent's successful sophomore albumThe Massacre. For an issue ofRolling Stonemagazine in April 2005, Dr. Dre was ranked 54th out of 100 artists forRolling Stonemagazine's list "The Immortals: The Greatest Artists of All Time".Kanye Westwrote the summary for Dr. Dre, where he stated Dr. Dre's song "Xplosive" as where he "got (his) whole sound from".cite webWestKanyeKanye WestThe Immortals – The Greatest Artists of All Time: 54) Dr. Drehttp://www.rollingstone.com/music/lists/5702/31963/32310Rolling StoneApril 21, 2005June 5, 2010

In November 2006, Dr. Dre began working withRaekwonon his albumOnly Built 4 Cuban Linx II.cite newsReidShaheemRaekwon Partners With Dr. Dre for Cuban Linx Sequelhttp://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1545239/20061108/raekwon.jhtml[[MTV News]]November 8, 2006March 2, 2008He also produced tracks for the rap albumsBuck the WorldbyYoung Buck,cite webJeffriesDavid"Buck the World" – Overview{{Allmusic|classAllmusicNovember 28, 2006May 26, 2008Curtis (50 Cent album)Curtisby 50 Cent,cite webReidShaheemRodriguezJayson50 Cent Album Preview: Eminem, Dr. Dre Help Curtis 'Keep It Funky'http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1568676/20070830/50_cent.jhtmlMTV NewsAugust 30, 2007May 26, 2008Tha Blue Carpet Treatmentby Snoop Dogg,cite webHoardChristianSnoop Dogg: Tha Blue Carpet Treatmenthttp://www.rollingstone.com/artists/snoopdogg/albums/album/12392153/review/12665512/tha_blue_carpet_treatmentRolling StoneNovember 27, 2006http://web.archive.org/web/20080417031714/http://www.rollingstone.com/artists/snoopdogg/albums/album/12392153/review/12665512/tha_blue_carpet_treatmentApril 17, 2008andKingdom Come (Jay-Z album)Kingdom Comeby Jay-Z.cite webJ-23Dr. Dre & Just Blaze Dominate Kingdom Comehttp://www.hiphopdx.com/index/news/id.4610/title.dr-dre-just-blaze-dominate-kingdom-comeHipHopDX.comNovember 7, 2006July 9, 2008Dre also appeared onTimbaland's track "Bounce", from his 2007 solo album,Timbaland Presents Shock Valuealongside,Missy Elliott, andJustin Timberlake.cite newsPetridisAlexisTimbaland, Shock Valuehttp://arts.guardian.co.uk/filmandmusic/story/0,,2045412,00.htmlThe GuardianMarch 30, 2007June 15, 2008LondonDuring this period, The D.O.C. stated that Dre had been working with him on his fourth albumVoices through Hot Vessels, which he planned to release afterDetoxarrives.cite newsNimaThe D.O.C. Interview (December 2006)http://www.dubcnn.com/interviews/thedoc/dubcnn.comDecember 2006January 31, 2013cite newsKiserChadThe D.O.C. Interview (Part 1) (April 2008)http://www.dubcnn.com/interviews/thedoc08-part1/dubcnn.comApril 2008January 31, 2013

Planned but unreleased albums during Dr. Dre's tenure at Aftermath have included a full-length reunion with Snoop Dogg titledBreakup to Makeup, an album with fellow former N.W.A member Ice Cube which was to be titledHeltah Skeltah,an N.W.A reunion album,and a joint album with fellow producerTimbalandtitledChairmen of the Board.cite newsMossCoreyN.W.A. May Still Have Attitude, But They Don't Have An Albumhttp://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1453589/20020424/nwa.jhtml[[MTV News]]April 24, 2002March 9, 2008

File:Dr. Dre.jpgthumbleftDr. Dre in 2008In 2007, Dr. Dre's third studio album, formerly known asDetox, was slated to be his final studio album.cite webCrosleyHillaryDr. Dre: 'Detox' To Be My Last Albumhttp://www.billboard.com/articles/news/1049098/dr-dre-detox-to-be-my-last-albumBillboardSeptember 21, 2007February 29, 2008Work for the upcoming album dates back to 2001,cite webhttp://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1453255/dr-dre-album-hiphop-musical.jhtml[[MTV News]] ([[MTV Networks]])Corey MossDr. Dre's Final Album Will Be Hip-Hop MusicalApril 4, 2002September 30, 2011where its first version was called "the most advanced rap album ever", by producerScott Storch.cite webhttp://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1484683/20040129/dr_dre.jhtmlMTV News (MTV Networks)Jon WiederhornDr. Dre's ''Detox'' 'The Most Advanced Rap Album Ever,' Co-Producer SaysJanuary 29, 2004September 30, 2011Later that same year, he decided to stop working on the album to focus on producing for other artists, but then changed his mind; the album had initially been set for a fall 2005 release.cite newsReidShaheemDr. Dre Gets His Groove Back, Revives Plans For Detox LPhttp://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1493418/20041103/dr_dre.jhtml[[MTV News]]November 3, 2004February 29, 2008Producers confirmed to work on the album includeDJ Khalil,Nottz, Bernard "Focus" Edwards Jr.,cite newsKaufmanGilFocus Is Busy With Eminem, Dr. Dre Albums – And A Free One Of His Ownhttp://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1582507/20080228/eminem.jhtml[[MTV News]]February 29, 2008March 2, 2008Hi-Tek,cite webJohnsonDickScratch Magazine "Covers" Dr. Dre's "Detox"http://sohh.com/articles/article.php/9451http://web.archive.org/web/20070621035619/http://sohh.com/articles/article.php/9451June 21, 2007July 24, 2006SOHHAugust 9, 2007J.R. Rotem,cite webCrosleyHillaryRotem Rolling with Dr. Dre, 50 Centhttp://www.billboard.com/articles/news/1063464/rotem-rolling-with-dr-dre-50-centJanuary 5, 2007BillboardAugust 9, 2007RZA,cite webhttp://www.rolandus.com/products/productdetails.aspx?ObjectIdRoland - MV-8800 | Production StudioRolandus.com2015-03-07Jay-Z,cite webShakeJay Talks Dre, Detox and Beyoncehttp://www.hiphopdx.com/index/news/id.4591/title.jay-talks-dre-detox-and-beyonceHipHopDXNovember 1, 2006August 9, 2007Warren G, andBoi-1da.cite webhttp://watch.muchmusic.com/specials/ota-live/ota-live/#clip131599New Music Videos | Watch Shows Online | Entertainment News & Celeb Gossip - MuchMusic.comWatch.muchmusic.com2015-03-07Snoop Doggclaimed thatDetoxwas finished, according to a June 2008 report byRolling Stonemagazine.cite webKrepsDanielSnoop Dogg Snoop Dogg Confirms Dr. Dre’s "Detox" is Finishedhttp://www.rollingstone.com/rockdaily/index.php/2008/06/26/snoop-dogg-confirms-dr-dres-detox-is-finished/Rolling StoneJune 26, 2008http://web.archive.org/web/20080801102042/http://www.rollingstone.com/rockdaily/index.php/2008/06/26/snoop-dogg-confirms-dr-dres-detox-is-finished/August 1, 2008After another delay based on producing other artists' work,Detoxwas then scheduled for a 2010 release, coming after 50 Cent'sBefore I Self Destructand Eminem'sRelapse (Eminem album)Relapse, an album for which Dr. Dre handled the bulk of production duties.cite newshttp://www.mtv.com/news/articles/160080l8/20081205/eminem.jhtmlNew Eminem Song 'Number One' – Apparently Produced By Dr. Dre – Drops On MixtapeReidShaheemDecember 5, 2008MTV NewsDecember 31, 2008cite newshttp://www.billboard.com/articles/news/266116/exclusive-eminem-talks-new-album-bookExclusive: Eminem Talks New Album, BookDecember 5, 2008BillboardMarch 31, 2009In aDr Peppercommercial that debuted on May 28, 2009, he premiered the first official snippet ofDetox.cite webConcepcionMarielDr. Dre Debut 'Detox' in Dr. Pepper Adhttp://www.billboard.com/articles/news/268516/dr-dre-debuts-detox-in-dr-pepper-adBillboardMay 29, 2009cite webDr. Dre Dr. Peppers commercial on YouTubehttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v50 Cent and Eminem asserted in an interview onBlack Entertainment TelevisionBET's106 & Parkthat Dr. Dre had around a dozen songs finished forDetox.cite newshttp://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1612353/20090528/dr_dre.jhtml50 Cent, Eminem On Relationship With Dr. Dre: 'We Understand Our Positions'ReidShaheemMay 28, 2009MTV NewsMay 30, 2009
article.heading: 200814:The Planets, a break and Coachella
article.paragraph: File:Dr. Dre at Coachella 2012 cropped.jpgthumbrightDr. Dre performs at theCoachella Valley Music and Arts Festival#20122012 Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival.On December 15, 2008, Dre appeared in the remix of the song "Set It Off (Kardinal Offishall song)Set It Off" by Canadian rapperKardinal Offishall(also withClipsePusha T); the remix debuted onDJ Skee's radio show.cite newshttp://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1601364/20081216/dr_dre.jhtmlDr. Dre Raps On Leaked Remix Of Kardinal Offishall's 'Set It Off'ReidShaheemDecember 16, 2008MTV NewsDecember 31, 2008At the beginning of 2009, Dre produced, and made a guest vocal performance on, the single "Crack a Bottle" byEminemand the single sold a record 418,000 downloads in its first week.cite newshttp://www.reuters.com/article/musicNews/idUSTRE51B7LK20090212Eminem's "Bottle" breaks download recordFebruary 12, 2009ReutersFebruary 16, 2009and reached the top of theBillboardHot 100 chart on the week of February 12, 2009.cite newshttp://www.billboard.com/articles/news/269427/eminems-bottle-breaks-digital-recordEminem's 'Bottle' Breaks Digital RecordSilvioPietroluongoFebruary 11, 2009BillboardJune 5, 2010Along with this single, in 2009 Dr. Dre produced or co-produced 19 of 20 tracks on Eminem's albumRelapse (Eminem album)Relapse. These included other hit singles "We Made You", "Old Time's Sake", and "3 a.m. (Eminem song)3 a.m." (the only track Dre did not produce was the Eminem-produced single "Beautiful (Eminem song)Beautiful").

On April 20, 2010, "Under Pressure", featuringJay-Zand co-produced withScott Storch, was confirmed by Jimmy Iovine and Dr. Dre during an interview atFenway Parkas the album's first single.cite webhttp://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1635417/20100405/dr_dre.jhtmlDr. Dre Announces Jay-Z Collabo, ‘Under Pressure’MTV2015-03-07cite webnhttp://www.rapbasement.com/scott-storch/041910-scott-storch-help-produce-dr-dre-and-jay-zs-new-under-pressure-single-from-detox-watch-here.htmlScott Storch Produces Dre's "Under Pressure"Rap Basement2010-04-192015-03-07The song leaked prior to its intended release in an unmixed, unmastered form without a chorus on June 16, 2010:cite webReidShaheemhttp://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1641742/20100616/dr_dre.jhtmlDr. Dre's 'Under Pressure,' Featuring Jay-Z, Leaks Online - Music, Celebrity, Artist NewsMTV2010-06-162010-10-10however, critical reaction to the song was lukewarm, and Dr. Dre later announced in an interview that the song, along with any other previously leaked tracks fromDetox's recording process, would not appear on the final version of the album.cite webhttp://www.hiphopdx.com/index/news/id.12355/title.dr-dre-says-under-pressure-other-leaked-detox-tracks-wont-make-albumDr. Dre Says "Under Pressure" & Other Leaked "Detox" Tracks Won't Make AlbumCheri Media GroupHipHopDXSeptember 27, 2010April 11, 2013Kuperstein, SlavaTwo genuine singles "Kush (song)Kush", a collaboration with Snoop Dogg and fellow rapperAkon, and "I Need a Doctor" with Eminem and singerSkylar Greywere released in the United States during November 2010 and February 2011 respectively:cite webhttps://itunes.apple.com/us/album/kush-feat.-snoop-dogg-akon/id405129686Kush (feat. Snoop Dogg & Akon) – Single by Dr. Dre[[Apple Inc.|Apple]][[iTunes Store]]April 11, 2013cite webhttps://itunes.apple.com/us/album/i-need-doctor-feat.-eminem/id415573229I Need a Doctor (feat. Eminem & Skylar Grey) – Single by Dr. DreAppleiTunes StoreApril 11, 2013the latter achieved international chart success, reaching number four on theBillboardHot 100 and later being certified double platinum by the RIAA and theAustralian Recording Industry Association(ARIA).cite webhttp://www.aria.com.au/pages/httpwww.aria.com.aupageshttpwww.aria.com.auSINGLEaccreds2011.htmARIA Charts – Accreditations – 2011 Singles[[Australian Recording Industry Association]]April 11, 2013

On June 25, 2010, theAmerican Society of Composers, Authors and Publishershonored Dr. Dre with its Founders Award for inspiring other musicians.cite webMitchellGailDr. Dre To Be Honored By ASCAPhttp://www.billboard.com/articles/news/957947/dr-dre-to-be-honored-by-ascapBillboardJune 5, 2010June 2, 2010cite webFounders Award Dr. Drehttp://www.ascap.com/eventsawards/awards/rsawards/2010/FoundersAward.aspxAmerican Society of Composers, Authors and Publishers7 September 2012

In an August 2010 interview, Dr. Dre stated that aninstrumentalalbum titledThe Planetsis in its first stages of production; each song being named after aplanetin theSolar System.cite webBarrowJerryDr. Dre Talks The Detox Wait,"Under Pressure" Frustration And Instrumental Albumhttp://www.vibe.com/posts/dr-dre-talks-detox-waitunder-pressure-frustration-and-instrumental-albumVibeAugust 3, 2010August 5, 2010On September 3, Dr. Dre showed support to longtime protgEminem, and appeared on his andJay-Z'sThe Home & Home TourHome & Home Tour, performing hit songs such as "Still D.R.E.", "Nuthin' but a 'G' Thang", and "Crack a Bottle", alongsideEminemand another protg, 50 Cent. Sporting an "R.I.P. Proof" shirt, Dre was honored by Eminem telling Detroit's Comerica Park to do the same. They did so, by chanting "DEEE-TOX", to which he replied, "I'm coming!"cite webhttp://rapfix.mtv.com/2010/09/02/eminem-jay-z-concert-detroit/?xrsEminem And Jay-Z: We’re Live From Detroit!Rapfix.mtv.comSeptember 20, 2010

On November 14, 2011, Dre announced that he would be taking a break from music after he finished producing for artistsSlim the MobsterandKendrick Lamar. In this break, he stated that he would "work on bringing his Beats By Dre to a standard as high as Apple" and would also spend time with his family.cite webHarlingDaniellehttp://www.hiphopdx.com/index/news/id.17603/title.dr-dre-says-after-27-years-of-working-on-music-hes-taking-a-breakDr. Dre Says After 27 Years Of Working On Music He's Taking A Break | Get The Latest Hip Hop News, Rap News & Hip Hop Album SalesHipHop DX2011-11-142012-03-30

On January 9, 2012, Dre headlined the final nights of the 2012Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival, on the weekends of April 1315 and April 2022, 2012.cite newshttp://latimesblogs.latimes.com/music_blog/2012/01/coachella-2012-dr-dre-radiohead-headliners.htmlCoachella 2012: Full lineup revealed; Dr. Dre, Radiohead headline[[Los Angeles Times]]2015-03-07

In a June 2014 interview with RapUpTV,Marsha Ambrosiustalked about working on Dr. Dres third album. She stated that she had gone to Hawaii before the end of 2013 for a few weeks to work with him on so many things including his upcoming album and a project of her own among other unspecified projects. Ambrosius also told RapUpTV that Dr. Dres third album is no longer calledDetox, but didnt reveal the new title.cite av mediahttps://www.youtube.com/watch?vMarsha Ambrosius Talks Visual Album, 'Detox,' & Kanye WestJune 19, 2014YouTubeIn a September interview with Shots Fired that same year, Aftermath Entertainment in-house producerDawaun Parkerconfirmed the title change. Parker also refrained from revealing the new title because of the fact that the title hadnt been leaked online. He also told Shots Fired that there are as many as 300 beats that have been created for the album over the years, but few of them have had vocals recorded over them.cite av mediahttps://www.youtube.com/watch?vDawaun Parker Talks DetoxSeptember 17, 2014YouTube

The length of time thatDetoxhas taken to record, as well as the limited amount of material that has been officially released or leaked from the recording sessions, has given it considerable notoriety within the music industry.cite webhttp://www.hiphopdx.com/index/news/id.17363/title.snoop-dogg-dj-quik-the-doc-others-team-up-for-dr-dres-detoxSnoop Dogg, DJ Quik, The D.O.C. & Others Team Up For Dr. Dre's "Detox"Cheri Media GroupHipHopDXOctober 25, 2011April 11, 2013Vasquez, AndrezNumerous release dates (including the ones mentioned above) have been given for the album over the years since it was first announced, although none of them have transpired to be genuine.cite webhttp://hiphopwired.com/2012/06/22/7-reasons-why-dr-dres-detox-will-never-drop/7 Reasons Why Dr. Dre's ''Detox'' Will Never DropHip-Hop WiredJune 22, 2012April 11, 2013Muhammad, Latifahcite webhttp://www.complex.com/music/2012/08/50-unreleased-albums-that-wed-kill-to-hear/dr-dre-detox3. Dr, Dre ''Detox'' – 50 Unreleased Albums We'd Kill To HearComplex Media[[Complex (magazine)|Complex]]August 8, 2012April 11, 2013Several musicians closely affiliated with Dr. Dre, including Snoop Dogg, fellow rappers50 Centand Game and producerDJ Quik, have speculated in interviews that the album will never be released, due to Dr. Dre's business and entrepreneurial ventures having interfered with recording work, as well as causing him to lose motivation to record new material.cite webhttp://www.hiphopdx.com/index/news/id.19070/title.dj-quik-does-not-believe-dr-dre-will-ever-release-detox-says-dre-is-professional-but-mean-in-studioDJ Quik Does Not Believe Dr. Dre Will Ever Release "Detox," Says Dre Is "Professional" But "Mean" In StudioCheri Media GroupHipHopDXMarch 20, 2012April 11, 2013Vasquez, Andrezcite webhttp://www.hiphopdx.com/index/news/id.22607/title.game-says-dr-dre-will-never-release-detox-Game Says Dr. Dre Will "Never" Release "Detox"Cheri Media GroupHipHopDXJanuary 19, 2012April 11, 2013Horowitz, Steven J.
article.heading: 2015present:Straight Outta Comptonfilm andComptonalbum
article.paragraph: On his Beats 1 radio show "The Pharmacy" on August 1, 2015, Dre announced that he would release what would be his final album, titledCompton (album)Compton. It is inspired by theN.W.AbiopicStraight Outta Compton (2015 film)Straight Outta Comptonand is a compilation-style album, featuring a number of frequent collaborators, including Eminem, Snoop Dogg, Kendrick Lamar, Xzibit and The Game, among others. It was released exclusively for iTunes and Apple Music on August 7. A physical version was published on August 21.cite webhttp://www.ballerstatus.com/2015/08/01/dr-dre-announces-final-album-compton/Dr. Dre Announces Final Album, "Compton"BallerStatus.comAugust 1, 2015cite webhttp://hiphopdx.com/news/id.34907/title.dr-dre-announces-compton-album-on-the-pharmacyDr. Dre "Compton: A Soundtrack By Dr. Dre" Release Date, Cover Art & TracklistHipHopDXAugust 1, 2015HipHopDXIn an interview withRolling Stone, he revealed that he had about 20 to 40 tracks forDetoxbut he didn't release it because it didn't meet his standards and he thought he was done being an artist. He also revealed that he suffers fromsocial anxietyand due to this he remains secluded and out of attention.cite webhttp://www.rap-up.com/2015/08/12/dr-dre-opens-up-about-detox-abuse-allegations-social-anxiety-in-rolling-stone/Dr. Dre opens about 'Detox', abuse allegations, & social anxiety in Rolling Stone[[Rap-Up]]August 12, 2015August 19, 2015
article.heading: Other ventures
Film career
article.paragraph: Dr. Dre made his first on screen appearance as a weapons dealer in the 1996 bank robbery movieSet It Off (film)Set It Off.cite webhttp://www.imdb.com/title/tt0117603/fullcredits#castSet It Off (1996) : Full Cast & CrewIMDb.com2015-03-07In 2001, Dr. Dre also appeared in the moviesThe Wash (2001 film)The WashandTraining Day.cite newsMossCoreyDr. Dre's Final Album Will Be Hip-Hop Musicalhttp://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1453255/20020403/dr_dre.jhtmlMTV NewsApril 3, 2002April 28, 2008A song of his, "Bad Intentions" (featuringKnoc-Turn'Al) and produced by Mahogany, was featured onThe Wash (soundtrack)''The Wash'' soundtrack.cite webBirchmeierJason"The Wash" – Overview{{Allmusic|classAllmusic2001April 28, 2008Dr. Dre also appeared on two other songs "On the Blvd." and "The Wash" along with his co-star Snoop Dogg. In February 2007 it was announced that Dr. Dre would produce dark comedies and horror films forNew Line Cinema-owned company Crucial Films, along with longtime video directorPhillip Atwell. Dr. Dre announced "This is a natural switch for me, since I've directed a lot of music videos, and I eventually want to get into directing."cite webDr. Dre To Produce Films for New Linehttp://www.illhill.com/headline.asp?idIllHill.comFebruary 9, 2007February 10, 2007http://web.archive.org/web/20080917141620/http://www.illhill.com/headline.asp?idSeptember 17, 2008Along with fellow member Ice Cube, Dr. Dre producedStraight Outta Compton (2015 film)Straight Outta Compton(2015), a biographical film about N.W.A.cite webRosenbergAdamhttp://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1638256/20100503/nwa.jhtmlN.W.A Biopic 'Straight Outta Compton' In The WorksMay 3, 2010MTV NewsJune 5, 2010
article.heading: Entrepreneurship
article.paragraph: File:Beats by dre.PNGthumb250pxrightBeats By Dr. Dre logoIn July 2008, Dr. Dre released his first brand of headphones,Beats by Dr. Dre. The line consisted of Beats Studio, acircumauralheadphone; Beats Tour, an in-ear headphone; Beats Solo & Solo HD, asupra-auralheadphone; Beats Spin; Heartbeats byLady Gaga, also an in-ear headphone; andSean CombsDiddyBeats.cite webhttp://www.beatsbydre.com/products/ShowProducts.aspxProductsNovember 11, 2009In autumn 2009,Hewlett-Packardparticipated in a deal to bundle Beats By Dr. Dre with some HP laptops and headsets.cite webhttp://www.hhspot.com/cover-story/dr-dre-teams-with-hewlett-packard-to-improve-sound-614.htmlhhspot Resources and Information. This website is for sale!hhspot.com2015-03-07HP and Dr. Dre announced the deal on October 9, 2009, at a press event inSanta Monica, CaliforniaSanta Monica, California. An exclusive laptop, known as the HP ENVY 15 Beats limited edition, was released for sale October 22. In May 2014, technology giantApple Inc.made a bid for the Beats by Dre brand for a reported $3 billion. This makes the takeover Apple's most expensive purchase by far.Cite newshttp://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/newsbysector/mediatechnologyandtelecoms/electronics/10861601/Apple-agrees-deal-to-buy-Dr-Dres-Beats-headphones-firm-for-3bn.htmlApple agrees deal to buy Dr Dre's Beats headphones firm for $3bnAndrew TrotmanThe Daily TelegraphMay 28, 2014The deal reportedly made Dr. Dre the "Richest Man in Hip-Hop", surpassing former leader,Sean CombsDiddy.Cite newshttp://www.theguardian.com/music/shortcuts/2014/may/09/dr-dre-apple-richest-hip-hop-headphones-beatsDr Dre's Apple deal will make him the richest man in hip-hopThe GuardianMay 9, 2014
article.heading: Philanthropy
article.paragraph: During the May of 2013, Dr. Dre andJimmy Iovinedonated a $70 million endowment to theUniversity of Southern Californiato create the USC Jimmy Iovine and Andre Young Academy for Arts, Technology and the Business of Innovation. The goal of the Academy has been stated as "to shape the future by nurturing the talents, passions, leadership and risk-taking of uniquely qualified students who are motivated to explore and create new art forms, technologies, and business models." The first class of the Academy began in September 2014.cite news[[The New York Times]]http://www.nytimes.com/2013/05/15/technology/dr-dre-and-jimmy-iovine-start-usc-program.htmlJennaWorthamMay 14, 2013Two Musical Minds Seek a Different Kind of Mogul
